metadata.name: Service Bus Namespaces
metadata.description: This module deploys a Service Bus Namespace.
Required. Name of this SKU. - Basic, Standard, Premium.
Optional. The specified messaging units for the tier. Only used for Premium Sku tier.
The type for a SKU.
Required. The name of the authorization rule.
Optional. The rights associated with the rule.
The type for an authorization rule.
Optional. The name of the disaster recovery config.
Optional. Primary/Secondary eventhub namespace name, which is part of GEO DR pairing.
Optional. Resource ID of the Primary/Secondary event hub namespace name, which is part of GEO DR pairing.
The type for a disaster recovery configuration.
Required. Name to access Standard Namespace after migration.
Required. Existing premium Namespace resource ID which has no entities, will be used for migration.
The type for a migration configuration

Optional. This determines if traffic is allowed over public network. Default is "Enabled". If set to "Disabled", traffic to this namespace will be restricted over Private Endpoints only and network rules will not be applied.

Optional. Default Action for Network Rule Set. Default is "Allow". It will not be set if publicNetworkAccess is "Disabled". Otherwise, it will be set to "Deny" if ipRules or virtualNetworkRules are being used.
Optional. Value that indicates whether Trusted Service Access is enabled or not. Default is "true". It will not be set if publicNetworkAccess is "Disabled".
Required. The IP filter action.
Required. The IP mask.
Optional. List of IpRules. It will not be set if publicNetworkAccess is "Disabled". Otherwise, when used, defaultAction will be set to "Deny".
Required. The virtual network rule name.
Required. The ID of the subnet.
Optional. List virtual network rules. It will not be set if publicNetworkAccess is "Disabled". Otherwise, when used, defaultAction will be set to "Deny".
The type for a network rule set.
Required. The name of the queue.
Optional. ISO 8061 timeSpan idle interval after which the queue is automatically deleted. The minimum duration is 5 minutes (PT5M).
Optional. Queue/Topic name to forward the Dead Letter message.
Optional. Queue/Topic name to forward the messages.
Optional. Maximum size (in KB) of the message payload that can be accepted by the queue. This property is only used in Premium today and default is 1024.
Optional. Authorization Rules for the Service Bus Queue.
Optional. A value that indicates whether this queue has dead letter support when a message expires.

Optional. ISO 8601 default message timespan to live value. This is the duration after which the message expires, starting from when the message is sent to Service Bus. This is the default value used when TimeToLive is not set on a message itself.
Optional. ISO 8601 timeSpan structure that defines the duration of the duplicate detection history. The default value is 10 minutes.
Optional. Value that indicates whether server-side batched operations are enabled.

Optional. A value that indicates whether Express Entities are enabled. An express queue holds a message in memory temporarily before writing it to persistent storage. This property is only used if the `service-bus/namespace` sku is Premium.
Optional. A value that indicates whether the queue is to be partitioned across multiple message brokers.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.

Optional. ISO 8601 timespan duration of a peek-lock; that is, the amount of time that the message is locked for other receivers. The maximum value for LockDuration is 5 minutes; the default value is 1 minute.
Optional. The maximum delivery count. A message is automatically deadlettered after this number of deliveries. default value is 10.
Optional. The maximum size of the queue in megabytes, which is the size of memory allocated for the queue. Default is 1024.
Optional. A value indicating if this queue requires duplicate detection.
Optional. A value that indicates whether the queue supports the concept of sessions.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Enumerates the possible values for the status of a messaging entity. - Active, Disabled, Restoring, SendDisabled, ReceiveDisabled, Creating, Deleting, Renaming, Unknown.
The type for a queue.
Required. The name of the topic.
Optional. Authorization Rules for the Service Bus Topic.
Optional. ISO 8601 timespan idle interval after which the topic is automatically deleted. The minimum duration is 5 minutes.

Optional. ISO 8601 default message timespan to live value. This is the duration after which the message expires, starting from when the message is sent to Service Bus. This is the default value used when TimeToLive is not set on a message itself.
Optional. ISO 8601 timeSpan structure that defines the duration of the duplicate detection history. The default value is 10 minutes.
Optional. Value that indicates whether server-side batched operations are enabled.

Optional. A value that indicates whether Express Entities are enabled. An express topic holds a message in memory temporarily before writing it to persistent storage. This property is only used if the `service-bus/namespace` sku is Premium.
Optional. A value that indicates whether the topic is to be partitioned across multiple message brokers.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Optional. Maximum size (in KB) of the message payload that can be accepted by the topic. This property is only used in Premium today and default is 1024.
Optional. The maximum size of the topic in megabytes, which is the size of memory allocated for the topic. Default is 1024.
Optional. A value indicating if this topic requires duplicate detection.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Enumerates the possible values for the status of a messaging entity. - Active, Disabled, Restoring, SendDisabled, ReceiveDisabled, Creating, Deleting, Renaming, Unknown.
Optional. Value that indicates whether the topic supports ordering.
Optional. The subscriptions of the topic.
The type for a topic.
Optional. FQDN that resolves to private endpoint IP address.
Required. A list of private IP addresses of the private endpoint.
Required. The name of the resource that is unique within a resource group.
Required. The ID of a group obtained from the remote resource that this private endpoint should connect to.
Required. The member name of a group obtained from the remote resource that this private endpoint should connect to.
Required. A private IP address obtained from the private endpoint's subnet.
Required. Properties of private endpoint IP configurations.
Optional. The name of the Private DNS Zone Group.
Optional. The name of the private DNS Zone Group config.
Required. The resource id of the private DNS zone.
Required. The private DNS Zone Groups to associate the Private Endpoint. A DNS Zone Group can support up to 5 DNS zones.
Required. The name of the service bus namespace topic subscription rule.
Optional. This property is reserved for future use. An integer value showing the compatibility level, currently hard-coded to 20.
Optional. Value that indicates whether the rule action requires preprocessing.
Optional. SQL expression. e.g. MyProperty='ABC'.
Optional. Represents the filter actions which are allowed for the transformation of a message that have been matched by a filter expression.
Optional. Content type of the message.
Optional. Identifier of the correlation.
Optional. Application specific label.
Optional. Identifier of the message.
Optional. dictionary object for custom filters.
Optional. Address of the queue to reply to.
Optional. Session identifier to reply to.
Optional. Value that indicates whether the rule action requires preprocessing.
Optional. Session identifier.
Required. Address to send to.
Optional. Properties of correlationFilter.
Optional. Filter type that is evaluated against a BrokeredMessage.
Optional. This property is reserved for future use. An integer value showing the compatibility level, currently hard-coded to 20.
Optional. Value that indicates whether the rule action requires preprocessing.
Optional. SQL expression. e.g. MyProperty='ABC'.
Optional. Properties of sqlFilter.
Optional. The type for rules.
Required. The resource ID of a key vault to reference a customer managed key for encryption from.
Required. The name of the customer managed key to use for encryption.
Optional. The version of the customer managed key to reference for encryption. If not provided, using version as per 'autoRotationEnabled' setting.
Optional. Enable or disable auto-rotating to the latest key version. Default is `true`. If set to `false`, the latest key version at the time of the deployment is used.
Optional. User assigned identity to use when fetching the customer managed key. Required if no system assigned identity is available for use.
An AVM-aligned type for a customer-managed key. To be used if the resource type supports auto-rotation of the customer-managed key.
Optional. The name of the diagnostic setting.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set the specific logs to collect here.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category group for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `allLogs` to collect all logs.
Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable log collection.
Required. Name of a Diagnostic Metric category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `AllMetrics` to collect all metrics.
Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of metrics that will be streamed. "allMetrics" includes all possible metrics for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable metric collection.
Optional. A string indicating whether the export to Log Analytics should use the default destination type, i.e. AzureDiagnostics, or use a destination type.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.

Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. The full ARM resource ID of the Marketplace resource to which you would like to send Diagnostic Logs.
An AVM-aligned type for a diagnostic setting. To be used if both logs & metrics are supported by the resource provider.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
An AVM-aligned type for a lock.
Optional. Enables system assigned managed identity on the resource.
Optional. The resource ID(s) to assign to the resource. Required if a user assigned identity is used for encryption.
An AVM-aligned type for a managed identity configuration. To be used if both a system-assigned & user-assigned identities are supported by the resource provider.
Optional. The name of the Private Endpoint.
Optional. The location to deploy the Private Endpoint to.
Optional. The name of the private link connection to create.
Optional. The subresource to deploy the Private Endpoint for. For example "vault" for a Key Vault Private Endpoint.
Required. Resource ID of the subnet where the endpoint needs to be created.
Optional. The resource ID of the Resource Group the Private Endpoint will be created in. If not specified, the Resource Group of the provided Virtual Network Subnet is used.
Optional. The private DNS Zone Group to configure for the Private Endpoint.
Optional. If Manual Private Link Connection is required.
Optional. A message passed to the owner of the remote resource with the manual connection request.
Optional. Custom DNS configurations.
Optional. A list of IP configurations of the Private Endpoint. This will be used to map to the first-party Service endpoints.
Optional. Application security groups in which the Private Endpoint IP configuration is included.
Optional. The custom name of the network interface attached to the Private Endpoint.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Tags to be applied on all resources/Resource Groups in this deployment.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.

An AVM-aligned type for a private endpoint. To be used if the private endpoint's default service / groupId can be assumed (i.e., for services that only have one Private Endpoint type like 'vault' for key vault).
Optional. The name (as GUID) of the role assignment. If not provided, a GUID will be generated.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
An AVM-aligned type for a role assignment.
Required. The name of the service bus namespace topic subscription.
Optional. ISO 8601 timespan idle interval after which the syubscription is automatically deleted. The minimum duration is 5 minutes.
Required. Indicates the Client ID of the application that created the client-affine subscription.
Optional. For client-affine subscriptions, this value indicates whether the subscription is durable or not.
Optional. For client-affine subscriptions, this value indicates whether the subscription is shared or not.
Optional. The properties that are associated with a subscription that is client-affine.
Optional. A value that indicates whether a subscription has dead letter support when a message expires.
Optional. A value that indicates whether a subscription has dead letter support when a message expires.
Optional. ISO 8601 timespan idle interval after which the message expires. The minimum duration is 5 minutes.
Optional. ISO 8601 timespan that defines the duration of the duplicate detection history. The default value is 10 minutes.
Optional. A value that indicates whether server-side batched operations are enabled.
Optional. The name of the recipient entity to which all the messages sent to the subscription are forwarded to.
Optional. The name of the recipient entity to which all the messages sent to the subscription are forwarded to.
Optional. A value that indicates whether the subscription supports the concept of session.

Optional. ISO 8601 timespan duration of a peek-lock; that is, the amount of time that the message is locked for other receivers. The maximum value for LockDuration is 5 minutes; the default value is 1 minute.
Optional. Number of maximum deliveries. A message is automatically deadlettered after this number of deliveries. Default value is 10.
Optional. A value that indicates whether the subscription supports the concept of session.
Optional. The subscription rules.
Optional. Enumerates the possible values for the status of a messaging entity.
The type for a subscription.
Required. Name of the Service Bus Namespace.
Optional. Location for all resources.
Optional. The SKU of the Service Bus Namespace. Defaulted to Premium for ZoneRedundant configurations by default.
Optional. Enabled by default in order to align with resiliency best practices, thus requires Premium SKU.
Optional. The minimum TLS version for the cluster to support.
Optional. Alternate name for namespace.
Optional. The number of partitions of a Service Bus namespace. This property is only applicable to Premium SKU namespaces. The default value is 1 and possible values are 1, 2 and 4.
Optional. Authorization Rules for the Service Bus namespace.
Optional. The migration configuration.
Optional. The disaster recovery configuration.
Optional. The diagnostic settings of the service.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Optional. The managed identity definition for this resource.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Whether or not public network access is allowed for this resource. For security reasons it should be disabled. If not specified, it will be disabled by default if private endpoints are set.
Optional. Configuration details for private endpoints. For security reasons, it is recommended to use private endpoints whenever possible.

Optional. Configure networking options for Premium SKU Service Bus. This object contains IPs/Subnets to allow or restrict access to private endpoints only. For security reasons, it is recommended to configure this object on the Namespace.
Optional. This property disables SAS authentication for the Service Bus namespace.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
Optional. The queues to create in the service bus namespace.
Optional. The topics to create in the service bus namespace.
Optional. The customer managed key definition.
Optional. Enable infrastructure encryption (double encryption). Note, this setting requires the configuration of Customer-Managed-Keys (CMK) via the corresponding module parameters.

variables.formattedUserAssignedIdentities: [reduce(map(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'userAssignedResourceIds'), createArray()), lambda('id', createObject(format('{0}', lambdaVariables('id')), createObject()))), createObject(), lambda('cur', 'next', union(lambdaVariables('cur'), lambdaVariables('next'))))]
variables.identity: [if(not(empty(parameters('managedIdentities'))), createObject('type', if(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'systemAssigned'), false()), if(not(empty(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'userAssignedResourceIds'), createObject()))), 'SystemAssigned, UserAssigned', 'SystemAssigned'), if(not(empty(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'userAssignedResourceIds'), createObject()))), 'UserAssigned', 'None')), 'userAssignedIdentities', if(not(empty(variables('formattedUserAssignedIdentities'))), variables('formattedUserAssignedIdentities'), null())), null())]

properties.encryption: [if(not(empty(parameters('customerManagedKey'))), createObject('keySource', 'Microsoft.KeyVault', 'keyVaultProperties', createArray(createObject('identity', if(not(empty(tryGet(parameters('customerManagedKey'), 'userAssignedIdentityResourceId'))), createObject('userAssignedIdentity', extensionResourceId(format('/subscriptions/{0}/resourceGroups/{1}', split(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('customerManagedKey'), 'userAssignedIdentityResourceId'), '//'), '/')[2], split(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('customerManagedKey'), 'userAssignedIdentityResourceId'), '////'), '/')[4]), 'Microsoft.ManagedIdentity/userAssignedIdentities', last(split(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('customerManagedKey'), 'userAssignedIdentityResourceId'), 'dummyMsi'), '/')))), null()), 'keyName', parameters('customerManagedKey').keyName, 'keyVaultUri', reference('cMKKeyVault').vaultUri, 'keyVersion', if(not(empty(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('customerManagedKey'), 'keyVersion'), ''))), parameters('customerManagedKey').keyVersion, if(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('customerManagedKey'), 'autoRotationEnabled'), true()), null(), last(split(reference('cMKKeyVault::cMKKey').keyUriWithVersion, '/')))))), 'requireInfrastructureEncryption', parameters('requireInfrastructureEncryption')), null())]

properties.notes: [if(equals(tryGet(parameters('lock'), 'kind'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot delete or modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.name: Service Bus Namespace Authorization Rules
metadata.description: This module deploys a Service Bus Namespace Authorization Rule.
Conditional. The name of the parent Service Bus Namespace for the Service Bus Queue. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. The name of the authorization rule.
Optional. The rights associated with the rule.
The name of the authorization rule.
The resource ID of the authorization rule.
The name of the Resource Group the authorization rule was created in.

metadata.name: Service Bus Namespace Disaster Recovery Configs
metadata.description: This module deploys a Service Bus Namespace Disaster Recovery Config
Conditional. The name of the parent Service Bus Namespace for the Service Bus Queue. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Optional. The name of the disaster recovery config.
Optional. Primary/Secondary eventhub namespace name, which is part of GEO DR pairing.
Optional. Resource ID of the Primary/Secondary event hub namespace name, which is part of GEO DR pairing.
The name of the disaster recovery config.
The Resource ID of the disaster recovery config.
The name of the Resource Group the disaster recovery config was created in.

metadata.name: Service Bus Namespace Migration Configuration
metadata.description: This module deploys a Service Bus Namespace Migration Configuration.
Conditional. The name of the parent Service Bus Namespace for the Service Bus Queue. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. Name to access Standard Namespace after migration.
Required. Existing premium Namespace resource ID which has no entities, will be used for migration.
The name of the migration configuration.
The Resource ID of the migration configuration.
The name of the Resource Group the migration configuration was created in.

metadata.name: Service Bus Namespace Network Rule Sets
metadata.description: This module deploys a ServiceBus Namespace Network Rule Set.
Conditional. The name of the parent Service Bus Namespace for the Service Bus Network Rule Set. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.

Optional. This determines if traffic is allowed over public network. Default is "Enabled". If set to "Disabled", traffic to this namespace will be restricted over Private Endpoints only and network rules will not be applied.

Optional. Default Action for Network Rule Set. Default is "Allow". It will not be set if publicNetworkAccess is "Disabled". Otherwise, it will be set to "Deny" if ipRules or virtualNetworkRules are being used.
Optional. Value that indicates whether Trusted Service Access is enabled or not. Default is "true". It will not be set if publicNetworkAccess is "Disabled".
Optional. List virtual network rules. It will not be set if publicNetworkAccess is "Disabled". Otherwise, when used, defaultAction will be set to "Deny".
Optional. List of IpRules. It will not be set if publicNetworkAccess is "Disabled". Otherwise, when used, defaultAction will be set to "Deny".
The name of the network rule set.
The resource ID of the network rule set.
The name of the resource group the network rule set was created in.

metadata.name: Service Bus Namespace Queue
metadata.description: This module deploys a Service Bus Namespace Queue.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
An AVM-aligned type for a lock.
Optional. The name (as GUID) of the role assignment. If not provided, a GUID will be generated.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
An AVM-aligned type for a role assignment.
Conditional. The name of the parent Service Bus Namespace for the Service Bus Queue. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. Name of the Service Bus Queue.
Optional. ISO 8061 timeSpan idle interval after which the queue is automatically deleted. The minimum duration is 5 minutes (PT5M).
Optional. Queue/Topic name to forward the Dead Letter message.
Optional. Queue/Topic name to forward the messages.

Optional. ISO 8601 timespan duration of a peek-lock; that is, the amount of time that the message is locked for other receivers. The maximum value for LockDuration is 5 minutes; the default value is 1 minute.
Optional. The maximum size of the queue in megabytes, which is the size of memory allocated for the queue. Default is 1024.
Optional. A value indicating if this queue requires duplicate detection.
Optional. A value that indicates whether the queue supports the concept of sessions.

Optional. ISO 8601 default message timespan to live value. This is the duration after which the message expires, starting from when the message is sent to Service Bus. This is the default value used when TimeToLive is not set on a message itself.
Optional. A value that indicates whether this queue has dead letter support when a message expires.
Optional. Value that indicates whether server-side batched operations are enabled.
Optional. ISO 8601 timeSpan structure that defines the duration of the duplicate detection history. The default value is 10 minutes.
Optional. The maximum delivery count. A message is automatically deadlettered after this number of deliveries. default value is 10.
Optional. Maximum size (in KB) of the message payload that can be accepted by the queue. This property is only used in Premium today and default is 1024.
Optional. Enumerates the possible values for the status of a messaging entity. - Active, Disabled, Restoring, SendDisabled, ReceiveDisabled, Creating, Deleting, Renaming, Unknown.
Optional. A value that indicates whether the queue is to be partitioned across multiple message brokers.

Optional. A value that indicates whether Express Entities are enabled. An express queue holds a message in memory temporarily before writing it to persistent storage. This property is only used if the `service-bus/namespace` sku is Premium.
Optional. Authorization Rules for the Service Bus Queue.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.

metadata.description: This module deploys a Service Bus Namespace Queue Authorization Rule.

Optional. For client-affine subscriptions, this value indicates whether the subscription is shared or not.

Optional. A value that indicates whether a subscription has dead letter support when a message expires.
Optional. A value that indicates whether a subscription has dead letter support when a message expires.
Optional. ISO 8601 timespan idle interval after which the message expires. The minimum duration is 5 minutes.

Optional. A value that indicates whether server-side batched operations are enabled.
Optional. The name of the recipient entity to which all the messages sent to the subscription are forwarded to.
Optional. The name of the recipient entity to which all the messages sent to the subscription are forwarded to.
Optional. A value that indicates whether the subscription supports the concept of session.

Optional. ISO 8601 timespan duration of a peek-lock; that is, the amount of time that the message is locked for other receivers. The maximum value for LockDuration is 5 minutes; the default value is 1 minute.
Optional. Number of maximum deliveries. A message is automatically deadlettered after this number of deliveries. Default value is 10.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.

Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
An AVM-aligned type for a role assignment.
Required. The name of the service bus namespace topic subscription rule.
Optional. This property is reserved for future use. An integer value showing the compatibility level, currently hard-coded to 20.
Optional. Value that indicates whether the rule action requires preprocessing.
Optional. SQL expression. e.g. MyProperty='ABC'.
Optional. Represents the filter actions which are allowed for the transformation of a message that have been matched by a filter expression.
Optional. Content type of the message.
Optional. Identifier of the correlation.
Optional. Application specific label.
Optional. Identifier of the message.
Optional. dictionary object for custom filters.
Optional. Address of the queue to reply to.
Optional. Session identifier to reply to.
Optional. Value that indicates whether the rule action requires preprocessing.
Optional. Session identifier.
Required. Address to send to.
Optional. Properties of correlationFilter.
Optional. Filter type that is evaluated against a BrokeredMessage.
Optional. This property is reserved for future use. An integer value showing the compatibility level, currently hard-coded to 20.
Optional. Value that indicates whether the rule action requires preprocessing.
Optional. SQL expression. e.g. MyProperty='ABC'.
Optional. Properties of sqlFilter.
Optional. The type for rules.
Conditional. The name of the parent Service Bus Namespace for the Service Bus Topic. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.

Optional. The maximum size of the topic in megabytes, which is the size of memory allocated for the topic. Default is 1024.
Optional. A value indicating if this topic requires duplicate detection.

Optional. ISO 8601 default message timespan to live value. This is the duration after which the message expires, starting from when the message is sent to Service Bus. This is the default value used when TimeToLive is not set on a message itself.
Optional. Value that indicates whether server-side batched operations are enabled.

topic.name: [format('{0}/{1}', parameters('namespaceName'), parameters('name'))]

metadata.name: Private Endpoints
metadata.description: This module deploys a Private Endpoint.
Optional. The name of the Private DNS Zone Group.
Required. The private DNS zone groups to associate the private endpoint. A DNS zone group can support up to 5 DNS zones.
Optional. The name (as GUID) of the role assignment. If not provided, a GUID will be generated.

Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
Required. The name of the resource that is unique within a resource group.
